channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: Hybristophilia: Study links TikTok to women’s sexual attraction to criminals
item.description: Ted Bundy had courtroom groupies. Jeffrey Dahmer and Richard Ramirez were sent love letters in prison. Now, in the age of social media, thousands like, share, and thirst in the comments over stylized fan edits of serial killers. There’s a term for this psychological phenomenon: hybristophilia.
item.dc:creator: Eve Upton-Clark, Fast Company

item.title: Cyber agencies produce ‘long overdue’ best practices for securing Microsoft Exchange Server
item.description: Cyber agencies from three countries including the US have issued a list of security best practices for protecting Microsoft Exchange Server, a venerable on-premises email server that many IT departments still cling to.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: How I ended up with 111,582 iPhone photos, and what I’m doing about it
item.description: Greetings and thank you once again for reading Fast Company’s Plugged In—and a happy Halloween to you. Recently, I used Apple Photos to revisit the photos I took during the 2015 Thanksgiving holiday. There were some gems in there—memories I’d like to preserve forever.
item.dc:creator: Harry McCracken, Fast Company

item.title: Florida residents fall victim to new crypto scam, $1.1M lost
item.description: Officials said these victims met the scammer on social media, and the scammer initiated a conversation.
item.dc:creator: Summer Poole, NewsNation

item.title: The AI ‘workslop phase’ is normal. Here’s how to fast-track your way through it
item.description: Every technological revolution has its awkward adolescence. We’re living through AI’s right now. Recent research from Stanford and BetterUp has given this moment a name: “workslop.
item.dc:creator: Kieran Colville, Fast Company

item.title: New LinkedIn phishing scam targets executives with fake board positions
item.description: No, you're not being invited to invest in South American businesses, you're being scammed into handing over Microsoft login credentials.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: Adobe struggles to assure investors that it can thrive in AI era
item.description: Adobe Inc. brought together 10,000 marketers, filmmakers and content creators to its annual conference this week to persuade them that the company's software products are adapting to artificial intelligence and remain the best tools for their work.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg, The Mercury News

item.title: Canadian government claims hacktivists are attacking water and energy facilities
item.description: Businesses operating ICS systems need “effective communication and collaboration," the Canadian government warns.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: NASA tests low-volume supersonic jet that could slash air travel time
item.description: NASA and Lockheed Martin debuted their first test run of a low-volume supersonic jet that’s expected to allow air passengers to travel faster than the speed of sound. The X-59 aircraft soared Tuesday from Lockheed Martin’s facility in Palmdale, Calif.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, The Hill

item.title: Nike partners with robotics company to create world's first motor-powered footwear system
item.description: Nike unveils Project Amplify, revolutionary motorized shoes developed with Dephy that add powered assistance to every step for runners and walkers.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: ABC, ESPN go dark on YouTube TV amid carrier dispute with Disney
item.description: Disney-owned networks like ABC and ESPN were taken off YouTube TV's channel offerings overnight as the two sides work to reach a new agreement on broadcast rights.
item.dc:creator: Dominick Mastrangelo, The Hill

item.title: The real reason your AI isn’t delivering ROI – and how to fix it
item.description: Over the last few years, the enterprise AI mandate has revolved around one question: “What can AI do?” That curiosity sparked a wave of pilots – creative, varied, and sometimes downright whimsical. Each offered lessons that deepened understanding of AI’s potential and limits.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Context engineering: Improving AI by moving beyond the prompt
item.description: Organizations deploying AI have focused heavily on prompt engineering as a method for generating the best results, but an emerging technique called context engineering will make AI tools more accurate and useful, experts say.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Nvidia partners with South Korean government, companies to boost AI development
item.description: Silicon Valley chipmaker Nvidia plans to supply its graphics processing units for projects with the South Korean businesses and government to advance the country’s artificial intelligence infrastructure and technologies.
item.dc:creator: Kim Tong-Hyung, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Republicans urge Trump administration to back Falun Gong lawsuit against Cisco
item.description: Two prominent Republicans on Capitol Hill want the Supreme Court to allow a lawsuit to proceed against tech giant Cisco over allegations that the company’s technology was used to persecute members of the Falun Gong religious sect in China.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligence race.
item.dc:creator: Michael Liedtke, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: The worst part of dial-up internet is back - Raspberry Pi modder lets you "hear" your Wi-Fi
item.description: A YouTuber used Raspberry Pi hardware to recreate the eerie dial-up screech, transforming Wi-Fi signals into nostalgic analog noise.
item.dc:creator: Efosa Udinmwen, TechRadar

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: Universal Music Group and AI platform Udio have settled a copyright lawsuit and will collaborate on a new music creation and streaming platform.
item.dc:creator: Kelvin Chan, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Windows 11: A guide to the updates
item.description: A Windows launch isn’t the end a process — it’s really just the beginning. Microsoft continually works on improving Windows 11 by fixing bugs, releasing security patches, and occasionally adding new features.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Oracle’s cloud strategy an increasingly risky bet
item.description: The financing arrangement for Oracle’s massive data center plan aimed at feeding the AI monster could result in a $38 billion debt offering as soon as next week, and according to this week’s report from Morgan Stanley, that figure could skyrocket to $55 billion – $75 billion as a result of the “shee
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Meta shares slide after company projects higher expenses for 2026
item.description: Meta's stock slid in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the tech giant posted strong third-quarter results but warned that its expenses will be significantly higher in 2026 than this year. Like its rivals, Meta Platforms Inc.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Nvidia has started the $5 trillion club. A look at its rise, by the numbers
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion. The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Microsoft Azure outage takes Xbox, Minecraft and 365 products offline
item.description: Downdetector shows fewer reports of 365 product disruptions, but Minecraft and Xbox outage reports remain elevated.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Oler, NewsNation

item.title: DHS attacks Washington Post over report on misleading footage of immigration operations
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) attacked The Washington Post over a report about footage of immigration operations the outlet characterized as misleading.
item.dc:creator: Tara Suter, The Hill

item.title: Tech companies break records, spending more money than ever on lobbying the EU
item.description: Major US tech companies are spending more money than ever lobbying the EU to influence its digital rules, Politico reports. Artificial intelligence and rules such as the Digital Markets Act (DMA) and the Digital Services Act (DSA) will be a particular focus.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, KRON4
